thread.title: NBA players to get more leg room in Delta deal
thread.title_full: NBA players to get more leg room in Delta deal

author: Carla Caldwell
title: NBA players to get more leg room in Delta deal
text:
NBA players to get more leg room in Delta deal Jul 6, 2015, 6:46am EDT Delta Air Lines, Inc. Delta Air Lines, Inc. flight attendants pose with the NBA Championship trophy. Delta flew… more Atlanta-based Delta Air Lines, Inc. (NYSE: DAL) will use Boeing 575s under a tentative agreement for National Basketball Association charters. The deal has NBA teams that fly Delta getting almost 50 percent more cabin space than on planes currently used, Bloomberg reports. Delta will use 11 of the airline’s Boeing Co. 757-200s (NYSE: BA), Bloomberg says. Delta has operated the service with eight Airbus Group SE A319s. Related Content See All Bizspace Properties Delta will fly as many as 27 of the 30 NBA teams. Delta says it flew 23 of 30 teams last season. The changes are included in a letter to U.S. regulators from the league, and offer a rare glimpse into how the biggest NBA charter operator caters to its high-profile clients, Bloomberg says. Delta’s NBA flights are a fraction of 1 percent of Delta’s sales, but the business helps boost profit and showcases the carrier for an elite audience, Bloomberg notes. NBA flights generated $65 million in revenue during the 2014-2015 season, according Delta. Delta says it flew 11 of 16 NBA teams during the 2015 NBA Playoffs - and flew the 2015 NBA champion Golden State Warriors home to Oakland International Airport .
